New Records: The Dodgers' bullpen had a 2.10 ERA and 27 strikeouts in 25⅔ innings, their best postseason performance in franchise history
Key Match Events: Fernando Tatis Jr. came to the plate with two on and one out in the third inning of Game 5, but was induced to a double play by Yoshinobu Yamamoto
Teoscar Hernández accounted for the Dodgers' other run in Game 5 with a seventh-inning home run
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers were considering using a bullpen game again in Game 5 after Game 4's bullpen game went well
Andrew Friedman praised the Dodgers' pitchers for executing and passing the baton to one another
Post-Match Reflections: Dave Roberts likened the series' intensity to the Dodgers' 2020 NLCS against the Braves and even the 2004 Red Sox against the Yankees when he was a player
Kiké Hernández said he won't run away from big moments, and that's what makes him get better in every situation
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers pitchers put up consecutive shutouts in the postseason for just the third time in franchise history
The Dodgers improved their record in elimination games under Dave Roberts to 13-7 (.650)
The Padres finished off the series hitless in their final 19 at-bats
Others: Shohei Ohtani had a huge three-run home run in the second inning of Game 1, but ended his first postseason series just 4-for-20 (.200/.273/.350), with 10 strikeouts
